column4: can someone point me to a channel best suited to find help for setting up a simple dhcp server?

Hello, I have tried to upgrade FGLRX driver and failed badly: I have removed it and then installed the new one build from the proprietary with --buildpkg ubuntu/hardy, then dpkg -i *.deb with the freshly built debs for the driver. Now I cant login, I get Xsession error about it not finding /etc/ati/ati-fglrx.sh or so... what should I do? How come the new fglrx driver does not put a file that is "needed"? Help! I am stuck in terminal now :
.. xorg.conf seems correct, install did not give any errors..
apt-get dist-upgrade should do the distro upgrade if you have the sources.list pointing to the 8.04 ones correctly..
##networking is deader than a door nail :)
not as dead as #ati i bet :P
i dunno, a page worth of information and post not a since response. all are sleeping.
well.. patience is what you need then :/
what kind of issue are you having with ATI? i have an x1200
